learnings.pattern: Cross-out marks (✕, ❌, X) used to show subtraction or removal
learnings.recommendation: NEVER use cross marks or strikethrough. Show ALL items and let child mentally subtract. For '7 apples, 3 eaten' show all 7 apples - child figures out 7-3=4 in their head.
learnings.correctApproach: Show full starting amount visually. Question describes what is taken away. Child counts total, subtracts mentally, writes answer.
learnings.wrongApproach: Showing crossed-out items OR showing only remaining items (both remove the mental math challenge)
learnings.childFeedback: Why are there X marks? Which ones do I count? This is confusing.

learnings.pattern: Daily routine and seasonal images missing from library
learnings.recommendation: Create or source these images: sleeping.png, sunrise.png, breakfast.png, bath.png, lunch.png, snowman.png, pajamas.png, dinner.png, sunset.png
learnings.childFeedback: I can't see the pictures - there are empty boxes.

learnings.pattern: Subitising dot patterns using images smaller than 30px
learnings.recommendation: Minimum image size for Reception is 30px, even for dice-like subitising patterns. 24px is too small for 4-5 year olds.
learnings.childFeedback: The pictures are really tiny and hard to see.
